New Records: Isaiah Joe set a career-high 31 points off the bench.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander recorded 39 points and 13 rebounds.
Karl-Anthony Towns achieved his 32nd double-double of the season with 23 points and 10 rebounds.
Key Match Events: The Thunder executed a 12-0 run in the first quarter.
New York's defense was described as 'atrocious' and allowed Oklahoma City to shoot 53.9% from the field.
Isaiah Hartenstein returned to Madison Square Garden and contributed six points, nine rebounds, six assists, two steals, and two blocks.
Post-Match Reflections: New York coach Tom Thibodeau criticized the team's flat start and defensive performance.
The Knicks fell to 14th in defense, six spots below their previous season's ranking.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Isaiah Hartenstein received a loud ovation and a video tribute upon his return to New York.
The game was highlighted by the Thunder's suffocating defense and the Knicks' struggles with their star players OG Anunoby and Mikal Bridges performing poorly.
